The clinical manifestations of COVID-19 include flu like symptoms, such as headache, fever and persistent dry cough, and atypical pneumonia that can lead to life-threatening acute respiratory distress.
2 While most patients with COVID-19 present with mild symptoms, this disease can cause hospitalisation, intensive care unit admission and death, particularly in older adults and those with comorbid conditions.
3 The case fatality rate of the disease is currently estimated at 2.7% and could be as high as 13% in older adults aged over 80 years.
